Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

The Project Controls Section provides project cost control, planning, and analysis support to JPL’s programs and projects.  We are seeking a Project Resource Analyst (PRA) who will serve as a key business team member. The Resource Analyst responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Analyze funding reports and research funds status.  Analyze JPL funds and burn rates and communicate funding needs to business team and/or line management.
  • Actively participate in the budget planning process by interfacing with the technical managers, analyzing submitted budgets, maintaining configuration management of various budget versions, and incorporating approved budgets into Oracle.
  • Prepare project financial reports (monthly/quarterly/annually) using business system reporting (such as Data Extractor, Oracle Business Intelligence) relative to budget creation, monitoring and analysis.  Analyze findings and report issues to business team.
  • Analyze and report project financial trend information in the generation of project business positions relative to the Institutional deliverables for Program, Planning, Budgeting & Execution (PPBE), Institutional Business Forecast (IBF), Monthly and Quarterly reviews, and NASA Form NF533 financial reporting
  • Update project/program task plan documents (statement of work, cost estimates, basis of estimate)
  • Create and maintain control accounts in cost management tools and ensure they are appropriately chargeable.
  • Validate that all Work Agreements (WAs) are complete and approved according to Institutional requirements; present metrics to lead PRA/Program Manager.
  • Contribute as a key team member on teams inside and outside organization, project, activity or function.

Qualifications

A successful candidate will have the following experience and skills:

  • Typically has a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or similar discipline with 1 year of related experience, or Master’s degree with 0 years of experience in similar discipline
  • Must be a strong user of Microsoft Office (Word and PowerPoint) with advanced Microsoft Excel skills (e.g. integration of information from multiple data sources, Power Query, Pivot Tables, and complex Excel function expertise)
  • Familiarity and experience with relational database concepts
  • Must be resourceful and self-motivated with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Must be able to interface effectively with team members of various disciplines and management.
  • Must be able to analyze complex data, develop effective messaging and present to multiple audiences.
  • Must be able to learn new concepts quickly and apply them effectively.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Robust business background
  • Experience with Oracle Business Intelligence custom reporting
  • Possesses critical thinking and analytical skills
  • Conducts work/tasks with accuracy
  • General understanding and application of standard principles, theories, concepts and techniques in a relevant field of knowledge.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
